intro: Erpetina, commonly known as the snake plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its upright, sword-shaped leaves that are typically variegated with green and white or yellow markings. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions and requires minimal watering, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its air-purifying properties have also made it a favored houseplant. Erpetina is also noted for its resilience, able to withstand periods of neglect and extreme environmental conditions.
